name: 心理語言學
comment: 上課教室在雲和街大樓二樓，地址為雲和街1號(位於雲和小火鍋斜對面、Cafe a la mode正對面)，從師大側門右轉看見Starbucks右轉進入巷子步行約2分鐘(130公尺)，右手邊就會看到雲和街大樓，亦可使用Google Maps APP查詢位置。請同學使用學生證感應，進出雲和街上課教室。
description:
This is a graduate-level course on the psychology of language. This course is meant to
introduce registered students to a selection of current issues regarding the relationship
between grammar and language processing. The topics to be explored will include, thought
not necessarily be limited to, the following:
 The architecture of grammar and its interfaces: Competence and performance
 Grammatical categories: Nouns and verbs
 Mass/count distinctions in grammar and cognition
 Lexical access and lexical representation (e.g. semantic ambiguity)
 Relative clauses and sentence processing
 Syntax and prosody
 Disfluency in discourse (hesitations, etc.)
 Working memory
 Priming studies: Lexical and syntactic effects
 Linguistic relativity: Language and various other modalities (e.g. space, mathematics,music, causal reasoning, etc.)
 Grammar and different kinds of evidence in linguistic argumentation
 Evolution of language
This course is intended to stimulate creative research in psycholinguistics. You are
encouraged to think about the questions that interest you, critically search and read relevant
literature, and, if possible, design experiments to test your hypotheses. I will be available to
talk about research ideas and how to put your ideas into empirical falsification. This course
does not intend to cover all topics in psycholinguistics. You should glance over the selected
topics to decide if they are of interest to you. Knowledge about statistics and psychological
experimentation, though will be helpful, is not required.
